721112f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 118th Street (East)
721112f-a.text:
1895 to 1885 (left to right) Lexington Avenue, at,
adjoining and south of the S. E. corner of East 118th
Street, showing a row of structures included in the
Mandel Estate auction sale on January 24, 1917.
At the right margin appears a partial view of a double-
front building that stands on the spot where Harlem
Road joined the Eastern Post Road. At the left is a
three story frame house bearing No. 152 E. 118th St.
1917

715175f-a.title: Manhattan: 118th Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
715175f-a.text:
131-133 East 118th Street, adjoining the N.W. corner of
Lexington Avenue. No. 133 is a three-story frame house.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Colleetion, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 154.

721109f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., north from East 118th Street.
January 4, 1937.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Art Project.

715174f-a.title: Manhattan: 118th Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
715174f-a.text:
(1)
152-154 East 118th Street, adjoining and east of the
S.E. corner of Lexington Avenue. This is a three-story frame
house.. (152).
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 158
(2)
The same, from a different angle, showing No. 152 only.
July 19, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
